characters.name: Do the antennae have apical spine-like hairs on flagellomeres 5 and 6?
Is the female antennae elbowed between the scape and the pedicel?

states: no, four times longer or less
characters.name: Is the scape at least five times longer than wide (measured at its widest point)?

states: no, scarcely deviating from long axis of scape
characters.name: Is the radicle inserted at a right angle to the long axis of the scape?

states: no, the radicle is clearly visible
characters.name: Is the radicle partially concealed by a basal depression in the scape?
Are the antennal insertions partially concealed under a well-defined transverse carina?
Are the inner margin of the eye strongly emarginate?
Are the vertex and gena bordered posteriorly by a continuous carina?
Is the entire posterior surface of the head concave?

states: yes, strongly concave, excavation length, measured along midline
no, weakly concave, excavation length, measured along midline, about as long as length of pronotum medially\par{}
characters.name: Is the posterior margin of pronotum strongly concave in the dorsal view?
Does the pronotum extend posteriorly beyond the anterior margin of the tegula?

states: no, pronotum closely attached to mesothorax
characters.name: Is the female pronotum movable and articulating with the mesothorax by a distinct suture?

states: two-thirds dorsal length or more of fused mesonotum-propodeum
pronotal length less then one-third dorsal length of
characters.name: How long is the female pronotal length in relation to the dorsal length of fused mesonotum-propodeum (measured medially, excluding anterior flange)?
How many distinct regions is the mesosoma divided into?
Is the mesothorax narrower than the prothorax?
Are tegula present?
Does the mesepisternum have a sloping groove traversing the entire sclerite?
Is there a pair of small lobes or plates (lamina) overlaying the bases of the midcoxae?
Is the metanotum separated from the metapostnotum by a distinct articulating suture?
Is there a strong anteromedial depression or pit between the midcoxae and hindcoxae?
Is the hind coxae separated from each other by a wide flat plate (metasternum)?
Is the propodeum divided into thirds by 2 longitudinal grooves that extend the full length of the propodeum?
Are the wings fully developed (forewing extending past the apex of the first metasomal tergum)?
Is the forewing folded longitudinally?
How many submarginal cells in the forewing are enclosed by tubular veins?

states: rectangular, as wide apically as basally
irregularly triangular, much narrower apically than basally
characters.name: What is the shape of single submarginal cell enclosed by tubular veins?
Is the first discal cell of the forewing shorter in length than the subbasal cell?
Is the membrane of the forewing textured with fine longitudinal wrinkles apically?
Does the hind wing have a jugal lobe?

states: no, not thicker than other femora
characters.name: Is the female forefemur swollen?
How many apical spurs are present on the hind tibia?
Is a comb-like series of hairs present on the medial surface at the base the hind tarsomere?
Is metasomal segment 1 node-like?
Is a strong constriction between sterna 1 and 2 in present in lateral view?
Does metasomal sternum 2 have a lateral longitudinal line of dense hairs (felt line)?
Does the last visible sternum have 3 apical spines?
Does the last visible male metasomal sternum form an upcurved hook?
Is the body strongly sculptured?
Does metasomal tergum 2 has a lateral longitudinal line (felt line) made up of dense hairs or a line of depressed cuticle?
Is the costal cell almost eliminated by the fusion of C and Sc+R+Rs except distally?
